verses.plain: But Job answered and said,

tokens.t: But Job answered and said,

verses.plain: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

tokens.t: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

verses.plain: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

tokens.t: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

verses.plain: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?

tokens.t: As for me,
my complaint to man? and if
, why should not my spirit be troubled?

verses.plain: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

tokens.t: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay
hand upon
mouth.

verses.plain: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

tokens.t: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

verses.plain: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

tokens.t: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

verses.plain: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

tokens.t: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

verses.plain: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

tokens.t: Their houses
safe from fear, neither
the rod of God upon them.

verses.plain: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

tokens.t: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

verses.plain: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

tokens.t: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

verses.plain: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

tokens.t: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

verses.plain: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.

tokens.t: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.

verses.plain: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

tokens.t: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

verses.plain: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

tokens.t: What
the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

verses.plain: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

tokens.t: Lo, their good
not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.plain: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.

tokens.t: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and
cometh their destruction upon them!
distributeth sorrows in his anger.

verses.plain: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

tokens.t: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

verses.plain: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.

tokens.t: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know

verses.plain: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

tokens.t: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

verses.plain: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

tokens.t: For what pleasure
he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

verses.plain: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

tokens.t: Shall
teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

verses.plain: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

tokens.t: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

verses.plain: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.

tokens.t: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.

verses.plain: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

tokens.t: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

verses.plain: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

tokens.t: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

verses.plain: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

tokens.t: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices
ye wrongfully imagine against me.

verses.plain: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?

tokens.t: For ye say, Where
the house of the prince? and where
the dwelling places of the wicked?

verses.plain: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

tokens.t: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

verses.plain: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

tokens.t: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

verses.plain: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

tokens.t: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him
he hath done?

verses.plain: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.

tokens.t: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.

verses.plain: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

tokens.t: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as
innumerable before him.

verses.plain: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?

tokens.t: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?

footnotes.text: his iniquity: that is, the punishment of his iniquity
his…: Heb. his very, or, the strength of, his perfection
the dwelling…: Heb. the tent of the tabernacles
remain…: Heb. watch in the heap
